flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: The TurtleBot mobile robot is designed for both academic and hobbyist researchers. The open source hardware design provides excellent documentation for adding modifications and extending the capabilities of the robot in hardware or software. The robot is available for purchase as a kit or, if your research budget is limited, this guide will help you extend your TurtleBot by adding an arm.
guide.introduction_rendered:
The TurtleBot mobile robot is designed for both academic and hobbyist researchers. The open source hardware design provides excellent documentation for adding modifications and extending the capabilities of the robot in hardware or software. The robot is available for purchase as a kit or, if your research budget is limited, this guide will help you extend your TurtleBot by adding an arm.

Relevant parts
  • TurtleBot Simple Gripper Pad
  • TurtleBot Arm Base Plate
  • F2 Bioloid Bracket
  • F3 Bioloid Bracket
  • F4 Bioloid Bracket
  • F10 Bioloid Bracket
  • S1 Bioloid Screw
  • S2 Bioloid Screw
  • N1 Bioloid Nut
  • Dynamixel AX-12A
  • Dynamixel BU (comes with servos)
  • Dynamixel WA (comes with servos)
  • Dynamixel S-B (comes with servos)
  • M2 fender washer
Tools
  • Screwdriver, small, Phillips

lines.text: Insert the servo in the base in the only orientation it will fit.
lines.text_raw: Insert the servo in the base in the only orientation it will fit.

lines.text: Next, put nuts (N1) in the bottom two holes of the servo on either side.
lines.text_raw: Next, put nuts (N1) in the bottom two holes of the servo on either side.

lines.text: There is a special technique to getting the nuts into the servos and to stay:
lines.text_raw: There is a special technique to getting the nuts into the servos and to stay:

lines.text: First, push the nut in by hand.
lines.text_raw: First, push the nut in by hand.

lines.text: Next, take a screwdriver and force it closer into the servo.
lines.text_raw: Next, take a screwdriver and force it closer into the servo.

lines.text: This will make the nut line up with the hole as shown in the last frame below, allowing you to screw into the nut.
lines.text_raw: This will make the nut line up with the hole as shown in the last frame below, allowing you to screw into the nut.

lines.text: A more in-depth demonstration is available here.
lines.text_raw: A more in-depth demonstration is available [http://www.crustcrawler.com/videos/bioloid/help/Inserting%20nuts%20for%20AX-12.wmv|here].

lines.text: We will be using this technique throughout the assembly process: to put it briefly, any time there is a nut, put the nut in first, lock it in, and then screw into it.
lines.text_raw: We will be using this technique throughout the assembly process: to put it briefly, any time there is a nut, put the nut in first, lock it in, and then screw into it.

lines.text: Turn the base around and put S2 screws into the corresponding 4 holes in the base plate, as shown on the right.
lines.text_raw: Turn the base around and put S2 screws into the corresponding 4 holes in the base plate, as shown on the right.

lines.text: Make sure that the groove on the servo horn, showing where the center is, lines up with the red line in the picture.
lines.text_raw: '''Make sure that the groove on the servo horn, showing where the center is, lines up with the red line in the picture.'''

lines.text: This offsets the center of the arm in order to allow it to reach to the back of the TurtleBot, but restricts its reach to the right. This essentially makes the robot "left-handed."
lines.text_raw: This offsets the center of the arm in order to allow it to reach to the back of the TurtleBot, but restricts its reach to the right. This essentially makes the robot "left-handed."

lines.text: Attach an F3 bracket to the servo horn with four S1 screws as shown.
lines.text_raw: Attach an F3 bracket to the servo horn with four S1 screws as shown.

lines.text: Now you can turn the bracket along with the servo horn.
lines.text_raw: Now you can turn the bracket along with the servo horn.

lines.text: Put the parts together as shown in the picture.
lines.text_raw: Put the parts together as shown in the picture.

lines.text: F3 bracket on top, F4 on the bottom, F10s in between.
lines.text_raw: F3 bracket on top, F4 on the bottom, F10s in between.

lines.text: Put nuts in 4 holes on the inside of the F4 bracket.
lines.text_raw: Put nuts in 4 holes on the inside of the F4 bracket.

lines.text: This is a similar procedure to step three, where you want to force the nuts in first so that they don’t fall out as you put in the screws.
lines.text_raw: This is a similar procedure to step three, where you want to force the nuts in first so that they don’t fall out as you put in the screws.

lines.text: However, since this is less of a press-fit, you may want to put your finger over the nut as you insert and tighten the screw.
lines.text_raw: However, since this is less of a press-fit, you may want to put your finger over the nut as you insert and tighten the screw.

lines.text: 1x Dynamixel S-B screw, the BU bushing insert, and WA washer
lines.text_raw: 1x Dynamixel S-B screw, the BU bushing insert, and WA washer

lines.text: Insert the bushing (BU) into the hole on the right side of the F4 bracket, and the washer (WA) on the inside of the bracket.
lines.text_raw: Insert the bushing (BU) into the hole on the right side of the F4 bracket, and the washer (WA) on the inside of the bracket.

lines.text: Insert the servo into the assembly, and use four S1 screws to fix the bracket to the horn and one S-B screw on the opposite side (to fix the washer and insert).
lines.text_raw: Insert the servo into the assembly, and use four S1 screws to fix the bracket to the horn and one S-B screw on the opposite side (to fix the washer and insert).

lines.text: Repeat the process with the other joint. You should again have two of these parts.
lines.text_raw: Repeat the process with the other joint. You should again have ''' ''two'' ''' of these parts.

lines.text: Put 4 nuts into the 4 slots on the bottom of each servo.
lines.text_raw: Put 4 nuts into the 4 slots on the bottom of each servo.

lines.text: Attach the top of the F3 bracket to the bottom of each servo and screw them in with S1 screws.
lines.text_raw: Attach the top of the F3 bracket to the bottom of each servo and screw them in with S1 screws.

lines.text: Note: It will take some force to snap the servos into the F3 brackets; make sure the holes on the bracket line up with the holes on the servos before you start screwing them in.
lines.text_raw: '''Note:''' It will take some force to snap the servos into the F3 brackets; make sure the holes on the bracket line up with the holes on the servos before you start screwing them in.

lines.text: Attach the left side of the gripper to an F3 bracket with four S2 screws, 4 nuts, and 4 washers.
lines.text_raw: Attach the '''left side''' of the gripper to an F3 bracket with four S2 screws, 4 nuts, and 4 washers.

lines.text: Attach the right side of the gripper to an F2 bracket, again with four S2 screws, 4 nuts, and 4 washers.
lines.text_raw: Attach the '''right side''' of the gripper to an F2 bracket, again with four S2 screws, 4 nuts, and 4 washers.

lines.text: For both grippers, make sure the tabs on the brackets face the same way as the bend in the gripper (that is, the gripper is closing towards the direction the tabs are pointing).
lines.text_raw: For both grippers, make sure the tabs on the brackets face the same way as the bend in the gripper (that is, the gripper is closing towards the direction the tabs are pointing).

lines.text: 1x Dynamixel S-B screw, bushing (BU) insert, and washer (WA)
lines.text_raw: 1x Dynamixel S-B screw, bushing (BU) insert, and washer (WA)

lines.text: Insert 8 nuts into the spaces shown in the picture.
lines.text_raw: Insert 8 nuts into the spaces shown in the picture.

lines.text: Attach the right side of the gripper (with the bigger bracket) to the servo horn.
lines.text_raw: Attach the right side of the gripper (with the bigger bracket) to the servo horn.

lines.text: Insert the bushing (BU) and washer (WA) on the opposite side of the bracket as before, use four S1 screws to fix the gripper bracket to the servo horn, and finally use an S-B screw to fix the bracket to the shaft on the other side.
lines.text_raw: Insert the bushing (BU) and washer (WA) on the opposite side of the bracket as before, use four S1 screws to fix the gripper bracket to the servo horn, and finally use an S-B screw to fix the bracket to the shaft on the other side.

lines.text: Attach the left side of the gripper (smaller bracket) to the bottom of the servo as shown below using four S1 screws.
lines.text_raw: Attach the left side of the gripper (smaller bracket) to the bottom of the servo as shown below using four S1 screws.

lines.text: 1x Dynamixel S-B screw, BU insert, and WA washer
lines.text_raw: 1x Dynamixel S-B screw, BU insert, and WA washer

lines.text: Use three S1 screws and nuts to attach the F3 and F2 brackets together at a 90-degree angle.
lines.text_raw: Use three S1 screws and nuts to attach the F3 and F2 brackets together at a 90-degree angle.

lines.text: Note: In the pictures the bigger bracket is offset on the smaller one; you should see three holes unobstructed on the smaller bracket.
lines.text_raw: '''Note:''' In the pictures the bigger bracket is offset on the smaller one; you should see three holes unobstructed on the smaller bracket.

lines.text: Attach the wrist assembly using 4 nuts (that should already be inserted from the previous step) and four S1 screws to the side of the gripper servo farthest from the horn so that the large bracket is centered on the side of the servo.
lines.text_raw: Attach the wrist assembly using 4 nuts (that should already be inserted from the previous step) and four S1 screws to the side of the gripper servo farthest from the horn so that the large bracket is centered on the side of the servo.

lines.text: Insert the servo into the assembly using, as always, four S1 screws for the horn, the Dynamixel insert and washer, and one S-B screw.
lines.text_raw: Insert the servo into the assembly using, as always, four S1 screws for the horn, the Dynamixel insert and washer, and one S-B screw.

lines.text: The wrist servo horn should be on the opposite side of the arm from the gripper servo horn.
lines.text_raw: The wrist servo horn should be on the opposite side of the arm from the gripper servo horn.

steps.title: Attach the Gripper to the Arm

lines.text: Slot 4 nuts into the bottom face of the wrist servo as shown.
lines.text_raw: Slot 4 nuts into the bottom face of the wrist servo as shown.

lines.text: Attach the top of the F3 bracket on the rest of the arm to the bottom of that servo.
lines.text_raw: Attach the top of the F3 bracket on the rest of the arm to the bottom of that servo.

lines.text: Make sure that all the servo horns face the same direction.
lines.text_raw: Make sure that all the servo horns face the same direction.

lines.text: Attach Standoffs to the Arm Base
lines.text_raw: Attach Standoffs to the Arm Base

lines.text: Screw the four standoffs into the holes on the base of the arm using 6-32 screws.
lines.text_raw: Screw the four standoffs into the holes on the base of the arm using 6-32 screws.

guide.summary: This tutorial takes you step by step through building an arm for your TurtleBot.
guide.title: Build an Arm for Your TurtleBot
